doc.ContractDescription: MODIFICATION TO RESTRUCTURE THE PRICING UNDER THE SUBJECT CALL ORDER BY CONVERTING ALL LINE ITEMS INTO A T&M LINE ITEM, AND TO ALSO INCORPORATE ADDITIONAL WORK WITHIN SCOPE. AWARD FROM REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS FOR "PROGRAM AND OUTREACH SERVICES FOR EPA'S LANDFILL METHANE OUTREACH PROGRAM (LMOP)" THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS CALL ORDER IS TO PROVIDE OVERALL PROGRAM AND OUTREACH SUPPORT SERVICES FOR THE LANDFILL METHANE OUTREACH PROGRAM. PROGRAM SERVICES MAY INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, OVERALL LMOP PROGRAM SERVICES, AS WELL AS, REGULATORY, AND TECHNICAL ANALYSIS TO SUPPORT CAPACITY BUILDING TO ACHIEVE METHANE EMISSIONS REDUCTIONS ACROSS THE WASTE SECTOR. SPECIFIC ELEMENTS UNDER PROGRAM SERVICES INCLUDE PROGRAM AND TECHNICAL ANALYSIS, CRM-DATABASE MAINTENANCE, TOOL DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE, AND PARTNER SUPPORT AND TRACKING. IN ADDITION, EFFORTS UNDER THIS CALL ORDER ALSO INCLUDE EXPLORING POTENTIAL CHANGES TO THE LMOP PROGRAM TO MEET ADDITIONAL INFORMATIONAL AND TECHNICAL NEEDS OF ITS STAKEHOLDERS, AND GAIN ADDITIONAL EMISSION REDUCTIONS IN THE SOLID WASTE SECTOR. OUTREACH EFFORTS UNDER THIS CALL ORDER MAY INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, MANAGING, UPDATING AND PROVIDING WEB CONTENT ON THE LMOP WEBSITE, CONVERTING THE LMOP WEBSITE TO DRUPAL, DEVELOPING AND UPDATING PUBLICATIONS AND MATERIALS, AND FACILITATING WEBINARS. doc.ContractDescription: ESTABLISHING THE EXTENT AND BIOMASS OF TROPICAL FORESTS IS A KEY COMPOENENT IN MODELING GLOBAL CARBON STOARAGE ESTIMATES. TROPICAL FORESTS REPRESENT SOME OF THE GREATEST BIODIVERSITY ON EARTH, AND TROPICAL COASTAL MANGROVE FORESTS ARE ALSO ONE OF THE MOST PRODUCTIVE FOREST SYSTEMS, NOT ONLY IN TERMS OF CARBON SEQUESTRATION, BUT ALSO IN TERMS OF LAND-TO-SEA CARBON FLUX AND ESTURINE/MARINE HABITATS. CONSIDERABLE SUCCESS HAS BEEN ACHIEVED USING REMOTELY SENSED DATA TO ESTABLISH GLOBAL AND REGIONAL FOREST STRUCTURE AND BIOMASS ESTIMATES.

doc.ProductorServiceCode: 6515: MEDICAL AND SURGICAL INSTRUMENTS, EQUIPMENT, AND SUPPLIES

doc.ContractDescription: TRANSPORT OF AIR FROM THE TROPOSPHERE TO THE STRATOSPHERE LARGELY OCCURS ACROSS THE TROPICAL TROPOPAUSE LAYER (TTL) TRANSITION REGION, TYPICALLY LOCATED BETWEEN 20 S 20 N LATITUDE AND ABOUT 14KM 18KM. THE TTL IS A UNIQUE PART OF THE ATMOSPHERE THAT DISPLAYS CHARACTERISTICS OF BOTH THE TROPOSPHERE AND THE STRATOSPHERE. THE STABILITY OF THE TTL (WITH TEMPERATURES ABOVE THE COLD POINT TROPOPAUSE INCREASING WITH HEIGHT) AND WEAK MERIDIONAL ADVECTION IMPLY A STRONG COUPLING BETWEEN TEMPERATURES, CHEMICAL COMPOSITION, RADIATION, AND VERTICAL VELOCITY. ANOMALOUS UPWELLING CAN DRIVE TEMPERATURE AND CHEMICAL COMPOSITION ANOMALIES, WHICH CAN FEED BACK ON THE CIRCULATION AND TEMPERATURES THROUGH RADIATION. THE PURPOSE OF THIS STUDY IS TO INVESTIGATE THE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN TEMPERATURE, ATMOSPHERIC COMPOSITION, UPWELLING, AND RADIATION IN THE TTL, WHICH COULD HAVE IMPACTS ON TROPICAL CYCLONE INTENSITIES AS WELL AS ON THE RATE OF GLOBAL WARMING. CONSISTENT WITH THE OBJECTIVES OF THE EARTH SCIENCE RESEARCH PROGRAM, THE STUDY INTEGRATES SATELLITE, REANALYSIS, AND OZONESONDE DATA TO IMPROVE THE UNDERSTANDING OF CLIMATE VARIABILITY AND ATMOSPHERIC COMPOSITION WHICH COULD HAVE IMPLICATIONS FOR HUMAN SYSTEMS THROUGH CLIMATE IMPACTS. WHILE THE RADIATIVE BUDGET OF THE TTL HAS BEEN STUDIED BEFORE, IT WAS DONE WITH LIMITED OBSERVATIONS THAT WERE SPARSE IN SPACE AND TIME. THE ADVENT OF A ROBUST (SPATIALLY AND TEMPORALLY) DATA RECORD FOR THE TTL, PROVIDED BY THE MICROWAVE LIMB SOUNDER (MLS), NOW ALLOWS A MORE COMPLETE PICTURE OF THE RADIATIVE BUDGET IN THE TTL, AND ONE STUDY OBJECTIVE IS TO UPDATE THIS BUDGET CLIMATOLOGY. IN ADDITION, "ABRUPT DROPS" IN TTL TEMPERATURES, WATER VAPOR, AND OZONE HAVE BEEN OBSERVED. ALTHOUGH THE ABRUPT DROP OF 2000-2001 WAS STUDIED PREVIOUSLY, THE DATA AVAILABLE AT THE TIME WAS NOT SUFFICIENT TO FULLY INVESTIGATE THE EVENT STRUCTURE. A RECENT ABRUPT DROP EVENT IN 2011-2012 ALLOWS BOTH COMPARISON WITH THE 2000-2001 DROP AND A DETERMINATION OF THE THREE-DIMENSIONAL SPATIAL AND TEMPORAL STRUCTURE OF THESE ABRUPT DROP EVENTS USING THE IMPROVED DATA QUALITY OF MLS. PRELIMINARY RESULTS SUGGEST THAT DURING ABRUPT DROPS WATER VAPOR, TEMPERATURE, AND OZONE REDUCTIONS ARE STRONGLY CORRELATED, AND REDUCTIONS IN TEMPERATURES AND WATER VAPOR OCCUR PRIMARILY OVER THE WEST PACIFIC WARM POOL. ADDITIONALLY, SEVERAL OTHER ABRUPT DROP EVENTS IN THE MODERN-ERA RETROSPECTIVE ANALYSIS FOR RESEARCH AND APPLICATIONS (MERRA) REANALYSIS HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED, AND A COMPARISON BETWEEN THE OBSERVED ABRUPT DROP EVENTS IN THE HALOGEN OCCULTATION EXPERIMENT (HALOE) DATASET, MLS, AND MERRA COULD REVEAL SIMILARITIES BETWEEN THE NATURE OF THE ABRUPT DROPS. THIS STUDY WILL ANALYZE TTL COMPOSITION AND TEMPERATURE VARIABILITY USING LAG/LEAD RELATIONSHIPS AND FAST-FOURIER TRANSFORMS TO DETERMINE THE STRUCTURE IN FREQUENCY SPACE. SPATIAL REGRESSION WILL BE APPLIED TO EXPLICITLY DETERMINE HORIZONTAL AND VERTICAL RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN VARIABLES DURING ABRUPT DROP EVENTS. BECAUSE TEMPERATURES AND COMPOSITION ARE COUPLED WITH RADIATION, THESE ABRUPT DROPS COULD ALSO HAVE IMPLICATIONS FOR UPPER TROPOSPHERIC TEMPERATURES (WHICH IMPACT THE THERMAL EFFICIENCY OF TROPICAL CYCLONES) AND SURFACE TEMPERATURES (WHICH COULD CONTRIBUTE TO THE RECENT OBSERVED "SLOW DOWN" IN GLOBAL WARMING). THIS STUDY WILL INVESTIGATE THESE POTENTIAL RADIATIVE IMPACTS AND TTL RADIATIVE FEEDBACKS DURING ABRUPT DROP EVENTS USING THE PARALLEL OFFLINE RADIATIVE TRANSFER (PORT), A STAND-ALONE RADIATION CODE DRAWN FROM THE COMMUNITY ATMOSPHERE MODEL THAT COMPUTES RADIATIVE HEATING RATES AND FORCING. THIS OUTPUT WILL BE USED TO QUANTIFY THE IMPACT ON TROPICAL CYCLONES AND THE "SLOW DOWN" OF GLOBAL WARMING.
doc.MajorAgency: NASA EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE FELLOWSHIP 2014
doc.MajorFundingAgency: NASA EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE FELLOWSHIP 2014

doc.ContractDescription: THE DIRECT AND INDIRECT EFFECTS OF ATMOSPHERIC AEROSOL ON EARTH S CLIMATE ARE UNCERTAIN AND PROCESSES SUCH AS CLOUD NUCLEATION ARE CURRENTLY A GROWING FIELD. AEROSOLS SPAN A SURPRISING DIVERSITY OF COMPOSITION; TROPOSPHERIC AEROSOL PARTICLES ARE OFTEN MIXED PHASE ORGANIC AND INORGANIC, WHILE STRATOSPHERIC AEROSOL PARTICLES CONTAIN TRACE SPECIES SUCH AS MINERAL DUST, METEORITIC MATERIAL OR VOLCANIC ASH. BECAUSE OF THE INHOMOGENEITY OF PHASE AND COMPOSITION OF AEROSOLS, FIELD ANALYTICAL TECHNIQUES WITH SINGLE PARTICLE RESOLUTION, SUCH AS SINGLE PARTICLE MASS SPECTROMETERS CONTRIBUTED SIGNIFICANTLY TO THE FIELD. PARTICLE ANALYSIS BY LASER MASS SPECTROMETRY (PALMS) BUILT BY NOAA AND DEPLOYED ON NASA WB-57F RESEARCH AIRCRAFT DURING CAMPAIGNS SUCH AS CRYSTAL-FACE IS ONE OF THE FEW SINGLE PARTICLE MASS SPECTROMETERS CURRENTLY IN USE. IT HAS EXCELLENT DYNAMIC RANGE, BUT IT CAN BE USED ONLY FOR DETECTION OF ELEMENTS PRESENT IN THE BULK OF THE PARTICLE. IT DOES NOT, GENERALLY, SPECIATE THE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS FOUND ON THE SURFACE. THE PALMS INSTRUMENT USES AN AERODYNAMIC LENS INLET TO SAMPLE SINGLE PARTICLES IN-SITU. THE PARTICLES ARE PASSED INTO THE SCATTERING REGION, WHERE THEY TRAVERSE TWO PARALLEL ND:YAG LASER BEAMS FOR AERODYNAMIC SIZING. WHEN THE PARTICLE PASSES THROUGH THE SECOND SIZING BEAM, A PULSED DEEP UV EXCIMER LASER IS TRIGGERED, WHICH ABLATES THE PARTICLE AND IONIZES THE ABLATED MATERIAL. AN ACCELERATING POTENTIAL THAN DIRECTS THE IONS INTO A TIME-OF-FLIGHT REFLECTRON MASS SPECTROMETER. A MASS SPECTRUM IS THEREFORE OBTAINED FOR EVERY PARTICLE WITHIN THE DYNAMIC RANGE OF THE INSTRUMENT. THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO DEVELOP THE NEW GENERATION PALMS. THE NEW PALMS WILL BE MINIATURIZED IN ORDER TO BE FIELD-DEPLOYABLE ON A SMALL UNMANNED AERIAL VEHICLE, SUCH AS THE NASA GLOBAL HAWK. THE PROJECT WILL DOWNSIZE THE TIME-OF-FLIGHT MASS SPECTROMETER UNIT, VACUUM, ELECTRONIC AND OPTICAL COMPONENTS OF THE CURRENT INSTRUMENT. THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF CURRENT TECHNOLOGY TO MINIMIZE THE SIZE AND WEIGHT OF THE INSTRUMENT BY A FACTOR OF 4. THE SPECIFIC GOAL OF THE PHD WORK PROPOSED HERE IS TO DEVELOP A SIMPLE AND COMPACT OPTICAL SYSTEM, CAPABLE OF AERODYNAMICALLY SIZING AND IONIZING THE PARTICLES. SPECIAL IMPORTANCE WILL BE PLACED ON FIBER-COUPLING OF THE SIZING BEAMS INTO THE SCATTERING REGION TO MINIMIZE THE NEED FOR FREQUENT ALIGNMENT AND CONTROL THE AMOUNT OF BACKGROUND STRAY RADIATION. A COMPACT METHOD OF FINE CONTROL OF THE EXCIMER LASER POSITION WILL ALSO BE DEVELOPED. WE PROPOSE THREE YEARS OF INSTRUMENT DEVELOPMENT INCLUDING FIELD AND AIRCRAFT TESTS. DANIEL J. CZICZO S LAB AT MIT OPERATES THE LABORATORY VERSION OF THE CURRENT PALMS AND IS, THEREFORE, ABLE TO TEST THE PROPOSED IMPROVEMENTS ON A WORKING PROTOTYPE.
doc.MajorAgency: NASA EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE FELLOWSHIP 2014
doc.MajorFundingAgency: NASA EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE FELLOWSHIP 2014

doc.ContractDescription: THE HELIOSPHERE SHIELDS AND PROTECTS THE SOLAR SYSTEM FROM THE INTERSTELLAR GALACTIC COSMIC RAYS AND INTERSTELLAR DUST AND GAS. THE CURRENT VOYAGER MEASUREMENTS OF THE PLASMA FLOWS REVEAL THE COMPLEX NATURE OF THE HELIOSHEATH, THE LAST BOUNDARY BETWEEN THE SOLAR SYSTEM AND THE INTERSTELLAR MEDIUM. OUR RESEARCH HOPES TO ANSWER THE QUESTION: CAN WE ACCURATELY MODEL THE FLOWS OBSERVED BY THE VOYAGER SPACECRAFT AND UNDERSTAND THE PHYSICAL NATURE OF THE HELIOSHEATH? WE WILL STUDY THE FLOWS IN THE HELIOSHEATH USING A GLOBAL 3D MAGNETOHYDRODYNAMIC (MHD) MODEL. WE WILL USE A KINETIC DESCRIPTION FOR THE NEUTRAL HYDROGEN STREAMING THROUGH THE HELIOSPHERE, COUPLING A PARTICLE-IN-CELL CODE WITH OUR GLOBAL MHD MODEL. WE WILL STUDY THE EFFECTS OF TIME-DEPENDENT SOLAR WIND IN THE HELIOSHEATH FLOWS USING LY# SCATTERING DATA FROM THE SWAN INSTRUMENT ON SOHO ALONG WITH INTERPLANETARY SCINTILLATIONS DATA, USING THE NEW CODE TO EXTEND OUR PREVIOUS RESULTS (PROVORNIKOVA ET AL. 2014). ADDITIONALLY, WE WILL INVESTIGATE THE EFFECTS THAT RECONNECTION HAS ON THE FLOWS BY EXPLORING THE EXISTENCE OF THE INTERCHANGE INSTABILITY IN THE HELIOSHEATH. JUST AS EARTH'S MAGNETOSPHERE PROTECTS THE EARTH FROM CHARGED PARTICLES EMANATING FROM THE SUN, THE HELIOSPHERE PROTECTS THE SOLAR SYSTEM FROM HIGHER-ENERGY PARTICLES IN THE INTERSTELLAR MEDIUM. BY ACCURATELY MODELING THE HELIOSPHERE, WE CAN UNDERSTAND HOW THE HELIOSPHERE WILL CHANGE AND HOW THE EARTH WILL BE IMPACTED WHEN WE ENTER INTO A DIFFERENT CLOUD OF INTERSTELLAR GAS OF VARYING CHARACTERISTICS. RESULTS FROM THIS RESEARCH WILL HAVE CONSEQUENCES NOT ONLY FOR UNDERSTANDING OUR HELIOSPHERE BUT FOR OTHER ASTROSPHERES AS WELL.
doc.MajorAgency: NASA EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE FELLOWSHIP (NESSF) PR
doc.MajorFundingAgency: NASA EARTH AND SPACE SCIENCE FELLOWSHIP (NESSF) PR

doc.ContractDescription: IT IS PROPOSED TO EXPERIMENTALLY STUDY THE HIGH PRESSURE HIGH TEMPERATURE PHASES OF HYDROGEN. IN PARTICULAR TO DETERMINE THE PLASMA PHASE TRANSITION (PPT) LINE, A FIRST ORDER LIQUID LIQUID PHASE TRANSITION FROM INSULATING LIQUID MOLECULAR HYDROGEN TO LIQUID ATOMIC METALLIC HYDROGEN. KNOWLEDGE OF THE PPT AND ITS CRITICAL POINT IS VITAL FOR AN UNDERSTANDING OF PLANETARY STRUCTURE AND FORMATION OF GAS GIANTS AND JOVIAN PLANETS. THE LOCATION OF THE PHASE BOUNDARY LINE BETWEEN MOLECULAR AND METALLIC HYDROGEN, AS WELL AS ITS NATURE, A DISCONTINUOUS TRANSITION (PPT) VERSUS A GRADUAL TRANSITION INSIDE THESE JUPITER LIKE PLANETS TREMENDOUSLY AFFECTS DENSITY STRUCTURE, HEAT TRANSPORT, THERMAL EVOLUTION AND COMPOSITION. BY EMPLOYING STATIC HIGH PRESSURE TECHNIQUES, MEASUREMENTS OF THE OPTICAL PROPERTIES OF HYDROGEN WILL BE CONDUCTED IN THE REGION OF THE PHASE DIAGRAM WHERE THE PPT IS PREDICTED. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO MAP THE PHASE LINE OF THE INSULATOR METAL TRANSITION OF HYDROGEN AND DETERMINE ITS CRITICAL POINT AT CONDITIONS SIMILAR TO THOSE THAT EXIST IN GAS GIANTS MANTLES. COMBINING TIME DEPENDENT OPTICAL CHARACTERIZATION TECHNIQUES WITH STATE OF THE ART PULSED LASER HEATING, WE PLAN TO MEASURE CHANGES IN THE OPTICAL PROPERTIES (TRANSMISSION&REFLECTIVITY) OF HOT DENSE HYDROGEN SAMPLES. A SHARP DROP IN TRANSMISSION ALONG WITH A SHARP RISE IN REFLECTIVITY IS A SIGNATURE OF A DISCONTINUOUS TRANSITION, WHILE A GRADUAL CHANGE IS A SIGNATURE OF A CONTINUOUS TRANSITION. THE P T POINT, WHERE THE TRANSITION GOES FROM DISCONTINUOUS TO CONTINUOUS IS THE CRITICAL POINT. THESE MEASUREMENTS WILL LATER BE UTILIZED IN CONJUNCTION WITH AVAILABLE DATA FROM SHOCK MEASUREMENTS TO VALIDATE OR RULE OUT EQUATION OF STATES (EOS) OF HYDROGEN THAT FIT OBSERVATIONAL CONSTRAINTS AND LOCATE THE ORIGIN OF THE MAGNETIC FIELD IN THE MANTLE OF JUPITER&SATURN. AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE PHASE DIAGRAM HAS IMPLICATIONS FOR GAS GIANTS STRUCTURE AND FORMATION THEORIES AS WELL AS RELEVANCE TO THE GRAVITATIONAL MOMENTS AND MAGNETOSPHERE MEASUREMENTS, EXPECTED BY THE JUNO MISSION.
doc.MajorAgency: THE PLASMA PHASE TRANSITION IN HYDROGEN FOR GAS GI
doc.MajorFundingAgency: THE PLASMA PHASE TRANSITION IN HYDROGEN FOR GAS GI

IGF::CL,CT::IGF PROCUREMENT OF PROFESSIONAL ACQUISITION SUPPORT SERVICES

WE PROPOSE TO STUDY THE EFFECTS OF MAGNETIC FIELDS ON THE FORMATION AND EVOLUTION OF GALAXIES IN A COSMOLOGICAL CONTEXT USING A NEW, STATE-OF-THE-ART, MOVING-MESH NUMERICAL METHOD FOR MAGNETOHYDRODYNAMICS WE RECENTLY DEVELOPED (MOCZ ET AL., 2014). MAGNETIC FIELDS AFFECT COSMIC STRUCTURE FORMATION BY FIELD AMPLIFICATION VIA DYNAMO MECHANISMS THAT ADDS PRESSURE IN GALAXIES, AS WELL AS BY COUPLING TO THE SELF-REGULARIZATION PROCESS OF GALAXIES. TREATMENT OF MAGNETIC FIELDS IN LARGE COSMOLOGICAL SIMULATIONS IN IS PRESENTLY LACKING, DUE TO THE LIMITATIONS OF EXISTING NUMERIC METHODS. WE PROPOSE AN APPROACH TO SELF-CONSISTENTLY STUDY COSMOLOGICAL STRUCTURE FORMATION WITH MAGNETIC FIELDS, WHICH IS CRUCIAL FOR ACHIEVING REALISTIC PROPERTIES OF MODELED GALAXIES. OUR PROJECT SUPPORTS THE NASA PROGRAM'S BROAD THEMES (I) PHYSICS OF THE COSMOS AND (II) COSMIC ORIGINS, BY GAINING INSIGHT ON HOW LARGE-SCALE MAGNETIC FIELDS SHAPE THE STRUCTURE AND COMPOSITION OF THE UNIVERSE AS A WHOLE AS WELL AS ON SCALES AT THE GALAXY LEVEL.
doc.ParentRecipientOrCompanyName: PRESIDENT AND FELLOWS OF HARVARD COLLEGE

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::CL,CT::IGF PROCUREMENT OF PROFESSIONAL ACQUISITION SUPPORT SERVICES

QUANTIFYING FLOOD RISK FROM CYCLONES IS CHALLENGING BECAUSE INSTRUMENTAL WATER LEVEL RECORDS GENERALLY DO NOT EXTEND FAR ENOUGH BACK IN TIME TO ACCURATELY CHARACTERIZE THE FULL DISTRIBUTION OF POSSIBLE FLOODING SCENARIOS. FURTHERMORE, EARTH'S WARMING CLIMATE WILL CHANGE THESE DISTRIBUTIONS IN THE FUTURE AS SEA LEVEL RISES, STORM CLIMATOLOGY CHANGES, AND SHORELINES EVOLVE. METHODS FOR INCORPORATING THESE IMPACTS, WHICH ARE OFTEN HIGHLY UNCERTAIN, INTO FLOOD FREQUENCY DISTRIBUTIONS ARE THEREFORE GREATLY NEEDED THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES; HOWEVER, THIS PROCESS IS ESPECIALLY DIFFICULT IN REGIONS WHERE EXTRATROPICAL CYCLONES (ETCS) SERVE AS THE DOMINANT MODE OF EXTREME FLOODING BECAUSE RELATIVELY LITTLE IS KNOWN ABOUT THEIR SENSITIVITY TO CLIMATE CHANGE. BOSTON, MASSACHUSETTS PROVIDES AN IDEAL SITE FOR ASSESSING THE COMPOUNDING FACTORS IMPACTING PAST, PRESENT, AND FUTURE FLOODING. ETCS ARE THE PRIMARY CAUSE OF FLOODING FOR THE CITY, AND BOSTON HARBOR IS CURRENTLY SHIELDED BY TWO DYNAMIC BARRIER BEACH SYSTEMS AND OVER THRITY SMALL DRUMLIN ISLANDS. THUS, WE PROPOSE TO IMPROVE FLOOD RISK ASSESSMENT FOR BOSTON BY 1) USING HYDRODYNAMIC SIMULATIONS TO INVESTIGATE A POTENTIAL CHANGE IN ETC CLIMATOLOGY EVIDENCED IN THE CITY'S HISTORICAL WATER LEVEL DATA, 2) FILTERING THE EFFECTS OF MANMADE COASTLINE CHANGE AND MEASUREMENT BIAS FROM HISTORICAL DATA AND COMBINING IT WITH TIDE GAUGE RECORDS TO RECALCULATE AND IMPROVE PRESENT-DAY FLOOD EXCEEDANCE PROBABILITIES, AND 3) INVESTIGATING THE EFFECTS OF PAST AND FUTURE COASTAL GEOMORPHIC CHANGES ON FLOODING FOR THE CITY. THIS RESEARCH WILL USE WIND FIELD DATA, ELEVATION DATA, AND SATELLITE IMAGERY FROM NASA IN ORDER TO IMPROVE PRESENT AND FUTURE FLOOD RISK ASSESSMENTS, ALIGNING WITH TWO OF THE OVERARCHING SCIENCE GOALS OUTLINED IN NASA'S 2014 SCIENCE PLAN: IMPROVE PREDICTION OF EXTREME WEATHER EVENTS AND FURTHER THE USE OF EARTH SCIENCE RESEARCH IN DECISION-MAKING THAT BENEFITS SOCIETY.

doc.ContractDescription: DENDRITIC MICROSTRUCTURES FORMED DURING CASTING, WELDING, AND BRAZING DETERMINE THE PROPERTIES OF COMMERCIAL METALLIC ALLOYS PRODUCED IN NUMEROUS INDUSTRIES, WITH APPLICATIONS RANGING FROM AUTOMOBILE ENGINE PARTS TO AIRCRAFT TURBINE BLADES. MICROGRAVITY EXPERIMENTS PROVIDE A UNIQUE MEANS TO INVESTIGATE MICROSTRUCTURE DEVELOPMENT UNDER WELL CONTROLLED CONDITIONS IN A PURELY DIFFUSIVE GROWTH REGIME WITH NEGLIGIBLE CONVECTION IN THE MELT. THIS PROJECT MAKES USE OF STATE OF THE ART NUMERICAL MODELS TO ESTABLISH BENCHMARK COMPARISONS BETWEEN THEORETICAL PREDICTIONS AND MICROGRAVITY EXPERIMENTS CARRIED OUT ABOARD THE INTERNATIONAL SPACE STATION ISS AND SOUNDING ROCKETS. THIS RESEARCH HAS FOR OBJECTIVES TO DERIVE FROM THOSE COMPARISONS FUNDAMENTAL INSIGHTS INTO MICROSTRUCTURE FORMATION AND TO ENHANCE THE PREDICTIVE CAPABILITIES OF COMPUTATIONAL MODELING. THE CONTINUATION OF THIS PROJECT OVER THE NEXT 3 YEARS WILL MERGE TWO ONGOING COMPUTATIONAL MODELING EFFORTS. THE FIRST EFFORT FOCUSES ON MODELING DIRECTIONAL SOLIDIFICATION EXPERIMENTS IN METALLIC AND CONCENTRATED TRANSPARENT ORGANIC ALLOYS IN THE FRAMEWORK OF THE ESA NASA CETSOL 5 PROJECT CARRIED OUT IN COLLABORATION WITH US AND EUROPEAN PARTNERS. THE GENERAL GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPROVE THE UNDERSTANDING OF COMPLEX PHYSICAL PHENOMENA GOVERNING THE COLUMNAR TO EQUIAXED TRANSITION CET IN ALLOY SOLIDIFICATION AND ITS CONSEQUENCES FOR INDUSTRIAL CASTINGS. THIS PART OF THE RESEARCH BUILDS DIRECTLY ON PROGRESS ACCOMPLISHED DURING THE FIRST TWO YEARS OF THE CURRENT GRANT. THE SECOND EFFORT FOCUSES ON MODELING DIRECTIONAL SOLIDIFICATION EXPERIMENTS IN THE DIRECTIONAL SOLIDIFICATION INSERT DSI OF THE DECLIC FACILITY DEVICE FOR THE STUDY OF CRITICAL LIQUIDS AND CRYSTALLIZATION ONBOARD THE ISS AS PART OF A CNES NASA PROJECT. THOSE EXPERIMENTS VISUALIZE FOR THE FIRST TIME IN DILUTE TRANSPARENT ALLOYS THE SOLID LIQUID INTERFACE EVOLUTION IN THREE DIMENSIONS UNDER DIFFUSIVE GROWTH CONDITIONS. THEY PROVIDE A WEALTH OF NEW OBSERVATIONS TO ELUCIDATE COMPLEX MECHANISMS GOVERNING THE SPATIOTEMPORAL EVOLUTION OF THREE DIMENSIONAL DENDRITIC ARRAY STRUCTURES. THIS PART OF THE RESEARCH BUILDS ON MAJOR PROGRESS ACHIEVED TO DATE IN THE SPADES PROJECT CARRIED OUT IN COLLABORATION WITH COLLABORATORS. BOTH PROJECTS INVESTIGATE BASIC ASPECTS OF DENDRITIC MICROSTRUCTURE FORMATION AND ARE HIGHLY SYNERGISTIC. SYNERGISM HAS BEEN INCREASED BY THE ADDITION IN THE CETSOL 5 PROJECT OF STUDIES OF THE TRANSPARENT ALLOY SYSTEM NEOPENTYLGLYCOL D CAMPHOR NPG DC. THIS SYSTEM ADDS THE CAPABILITY TO VISUALIZE BOTH COLUMNAR AND EQUIAXED DENDRITIC GRAIN DEVELOPMENT AND THE CET IN A CONCENTRATED ALLOY REGIME, THEREBY COMPLEMENTING THE DECLIC DSI STUDIES OF COLUMNAR DENDRITES IN DILUTE SCN CAMPHOR ALLOYS. SYNERGISM BETWEEN THOSE PROJECTS ALSO STEMS FROM THE FACT THAT BASIC INSIGHTS INTO DENDRITE MICROSTRUCTURE FORMATION OBTAINED IN THE DECLIC DSI STUDIES ARE DIRECTLY RELEVANT TO UNDERSTANDING AND MODELING THE COLUMNAR TO EQUIAXED TRANSITION.
